non_residential_details.development_type: Change of Use with Extension(s) over 999sqm

description: Alterations, refurbishment and extensions to King's Cross Station to provide for new operational railway purposes and passenger facilities, including construction of Western Concourse (to include ticketing, retail {Class A1}, food and drink facilities {Class A3/A4/A5} and ancillary office accommodation and integrated access facilities to London Underground Northern Ticket hall), demolition of southern concourse and landscaping of new southern square; alterations to Western Range;  construction of platform Y and alterations to platforms 1 and 5-8; construction of canopies to south elevation of main train shed and taxi waiting areas; enclosure of London Underground South-East stairs; permanent removal of Porte Cochere and northern canopy to Western Range, Great Northern Hotel porch and other items; demolition and replacement of Handyside pedestrian footbridge and demolition of elements of suburban train shed and of other structures; and other alterations, operations and extensions in connection with new uses and facilities. THIS APPLICATION IS ACCOMPANIED BY AN ENVIRONMENTAL STATEMENT.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development herby permitted must not be begun later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. 

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - Prior to bringing into use of the Western Concourse all hard and soft landscaping other than within the area identified as the Southern Square on drawing AL-00G-S, shall be installed in accordance with the agreed landscape specification, design details and management plan.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is designed and maintained to a satisfactory high standard of visual amenity in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 3 - Within two years of commencement of development a landscape specification, design details and management plan including long term design objectives, management responsibilities, a programme for implementation and maintenance schedules for all hard and soft landscape areas within the boundaries of the site must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. For the avoidance of doubt the details of hard landscaping shall include the design, locations, dimensions and specifications of parking and loading bays within the site, security measures such as permanent bollards or obstructions and CCTV installation. Approved works shall be carried out in accordance with conditions 3, 4 and 5 and thereafter retained.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is designed and maintained to a high standard of visual amenity in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 4 - All landscaping works within the southern square shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the demolition of the existing southern concourse. 

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is designed and maintained to a satisfactory high standard of visual amenity in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 5 - Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 6 - By no later than 31st March 2013 or within eighteen months of bringing into use of the new concourse whichever is the sooner the existing southern concourse shall be demolished. 

Reason: To safeguard the special character and appearance of the conservation area and the area in general in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 7 - Details in respect of all new works including the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council as local planning authority before the relevant work is begun.  The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such approved details.
  a. Layout details of the taxi pick-up passenger queuing arrangements including any pedestrian crossovers to taxi pick-up island and trolley corrals
  b. Layout details of the taxi drop-off arrangements.
All to be provided at a minimum of 1:50.  

Reason: to ensure the highway safety of passengers and other road users and to secure the delivery of high quality landscaping in accordance with policies S10, T15, KC6, B1 and SKC1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 8 - Prior to bringing into use of the Western Concourse the 3 disabled parking bays to be provided within the site shall be clearly marked out. Thereafter the spaces shall be used for this purpose only and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: To ensure the highest standards of access and inclusion throughout the development site in accordance with policies S10, SD1(c),  KC6 and B1(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.  
Condition : 9 - Prior to bringing into use of the Western Concourse details of the location, phasing and design of secure parking racks for 204 bicycles shall be submitted to and approved by the council. Thereafter the racks shall be installed in accordance with the agreed phasing and design. Thereafter the racks shall be used for this purpose only and shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: To ensure a)the highest standards of access and inclusion throughout the development site, and b)to encourage the use of other modes of transportation other than the private car in accordance with policies S9, SD1(c), B1(b), KC6 and T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 10 - The detailed design of the Interim Services Yard shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before any relevant construction is begun. The submission to include details of location, size and design, phasing of works and bringing into use, programme of works, details of traffic movements and quantities, access arrangements from the relevant public highway, control and marshalling methodology and hours of operation of the yard. The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such strategy thus approved and the Interim Services Yard shall be operational for no more than two years unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: In order to safeguard highway safety in accordance with policy T9(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 11 - Not Used 
 
Condition : 12 - A detailed design of the basement plant room shall be submitted to and approved by the Council as local planning authority before relevant works are begun. The submission to include details of any external impact resulting from the provision of venting and extraction of fumes, smoke etc from the plant room. The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such strategy thus approved.

Reason: To ensure that the design of the plant room respects its site and setting and to safeguard the amenities of the premises and the area generally in accordance with policies B1(a) and SD6(e) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 13 - No loading or unloading of goods including fuel, associated with the operation of the station, by vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the service yard until a period of two years has elapsed from being brought into use or such time as the Basement Shared Services Yard and associated access routes are completed and ready for use,  whichever is sooner, at which point use of the Interim Services Yard shall cease and all servicing shall take place from within the shared basement facility. 

Reason: To safeguard Highway safety and to avoid obstruction of surrounding streets and the amenities of adjacent properties in accordance with policies S10 and T16(a) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 14 - The various service bays within the site shall be clearly marked out stating "No Parking" in a manner agreed with the council before their use commences. Thereafter, at no time shall any goods, vehicles, plant equipment or other obstruction be left in this area and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: In order to safeguard traffic and pedestrian safety conditions within the site in accordance with policies S10 and T9(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 15 - Before the development is occupied the various taxi and private vehicle drop-off and pick-up spaces within the site shall be clearly marked out in a manner agreed with the council. Thereafter, at no time shall any goods, vehicles, plant equipment or other obstruction be left in this area and the markings shall be permanently maintained and retained unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: In order to safeguard traffic and pedestrian safety conditions within the site in accordance with policies S10 and T9(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 16 - No works authorised by this consent shall take place until a Signage  and Advertising strategy has been submitted to and approved by the Council as local planning authority. The strategy to include details of:
i.	the hierarchy of signage throughout the site
ii.	the number, size, location and level of illumination of all signage including wayfinding, passenger information, retail fascia, corporate branding and advertisements
iii.	details of the materials, form and colour of graphics in all signage
iv.	the methods of fixing signage where historic fabric will be affectedThe relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such strategy thus approved.

Reason: In order to ensure the provision of adequate public wayfinding and orientation information and to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policies SD1(c) and B6(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 17 - Within a year of commencement of works a Lighting Strategy shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. The strategy to provide details of all lighting schemes within the public areas of the site, including design and specification details of typical lighting units, fittings, fixtures and poles. For the avoidance of doubt this shall include details of lighting within the concourse perimeter and within the curtilage of the canopies. The strategy shall also include details of all architectural or feature lighting within the site. The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such strategy thus approved.

Reason: In order to safeguard public safety and to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policies SD1(d) and B6 (b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 18 - The accommodation identified as 'retail' in the submitted 'Stage D Comprehensive Accommodation Schedule C1 rev01, C2 rev04, C3 rev 03, C4 rev 01 and C5 rev 01' (hereafter referred to as the approved accommodation schedule) shall only be occupied by uses falling within Classes A1 and A2 of the Town and Country Planning (Uses Classes) Order, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification. 

The accommodation identified as 'retail/catering' in the approved accommodation schedule shall only be occupied by uses falling within Classes A1, A2, A3 and A5 of the Town and Country Planning (Uses Classes) Order, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification.

The total floorspace within the concourse and western range for occupation under Use Classes A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5 hereby consented shall be limited to 2912m2. This floorspace figure includes six (6) mobile retail barrows of 5.5m2 each. For the avoidance of doubt retail floorspace excludes ticket sales and other provision directly related to the movement of traffic by rail. No increase in floorspace within these use classes may be permitted unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: To ensure the concourse public spaces are maintained free of further obstruction and to ensure that the retail and entertainment uses do not harm the character, amenity, function, vitality  and viability of existing local facilities in accordance with policies S1, SD3 and SKC2 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 19 - The quantum of floorspace provided for A4 (public house) uses within the station shall be limited to 691m2, to include front of house, back of house, wcs and balcony space. No increase in floorspace within this use class may be permitted unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: to limit the potential for negative impact on the character of the area resulting from an intensification of drinking and entertainment activity within the station in accordance with policies SKC1, SD3, KC1 and SKC2 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 20 - The quantum of floorspace provided for A3 and A5 uses within the station shall be limited to 1361m2. This shall comprise 1361of food preparation, storage, back-of-house and sales floorspace. The shared seating space associated with these uses located on the mezzanine shall be 725m2 as  shown on drawing number AL-001-C rev 03 and shall be provided and retained as available for shared public use. . No increase in floorspace within these use classes may be permitted unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: to limit the potential for negative impact on the character of the area resulting from an intensification of restaurant activity within the station and to ensure that the concourse public spaces are maintained free of further obstruction in accordance with policies SKC1, SKC2, KC1(e), SD3 and B1(b)& (c) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 21 - The preparation of hot food for consumption on or off the premises is limited to the following units as identified on the submitted 'Stage D Comprehensive Accommodation Schedule C1 rev01, C2 rev04, C3 rev 03, C4 rev 01 and C5 rev 01' and accompanying plans: CG05, CG06, CG14, CG15, G03, G04, G14, G15 , G17, G31, M1/05, M1/06, M1/06a, M1/07, M1/07a, M1/09, M1/09a, M1/10, M1/10a, M1/12, M1/12a, 1/35, 1/36 , 1/37 and 1/38. No hot food may be prepared within the station other than within the above units unless prior written consent is given by the Council. For the avoidance of doubt this limitation also precludes the preparation of hot food as part of the On Board Services facilities in the basements.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 22 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no structures shall be erected which impede the free passage of station users within the public areas of the concourse, other than those expressly authorised by this permission, unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: to ensure the safe and unimpeded passage of station users in accordance with policies SD1(d), B1(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 23 - Details in respect of all new works including the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council as local planning authority before any work is begun.  The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with such approved details.

Detailed floorplan (minimum scale 1:100) of ground and mezzanine levels showing final position of unit boundaries, and indicating how the corridor ends have been splayed to provide clear visibility for travellers at the concourse end. 

Reason: to ensure the safe and unimpeded passage of station users in accordance with policies SD1(d), B1(b) and KC8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 24 - Notwithstanding the details given on drawing AL-00G-S rev 03 and approved schedule 'Schedule C2 Rev 04' nothing in this permission grants consent for the installation of retail uses within the curtilage of the circular LUL vent in the southern square (identified as units G46, G48, G50 and G52). 

Reason: to limit the potential for negative impact on the character of the area resulting from an intensification of outdoor retail within the site in accordance with policies SKC1, SKC2, SD3 and KC1(e), of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 25 - No development shall take place until:
a.	The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; and
b.	The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council.
All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy SD10B of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 26 - No works authorised by this consent shall take place until details of an air quality monitoring scheme covering both the construction and occupation phases including methodology for regular reporting of results has been submitted to and approved by the Council as local planning authority. The methods undertaken shall be carried out in accordance with details which shall have been approved.

Reason: To prevent harm to air quality locally in accordance with policy SD9(a) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006
Condition : 27 - No works authorised by this consent shall take place until details of surface water drainage works has been submitted to and approved by the Council as local planning authority. Such details to include calculations, pipe and pump design where relevant and a drainage maintenance strategy. The works undertaken shall be carried out in accordance with details which shall have been approved. 

Reason: To prevent the increased risk of surface water flooding and to improve water efficiency in accordance with policy SD9(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 28 - Prior to commencement of works, a Water Efficiency Strategy and plans describing and illustrating the water recycling and re-use systems in the development, must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure building and users are energy and resource  efficient in accordance with policies S3 and SD9(c) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 29 - No external plant or other noise generating equipment shall be installed on the external surfaces of the building unless shown on the drawings hereby approved, unless prior written consent is given by the Council.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally and to protect the special architectural interest of the listed building in accordance with the requirements of policiesSD6(d) and B6(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 30 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all plant/equipment are in operation unless the plant/equipment hereby permitted will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps), then the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade shall be at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6(d),  and SD7(b) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 31 - Before first bringing into use of the concourse, the scheme for the ventilation of and the extraction of fumes from approved catering premises to an adequate outlet shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. Details provided should include:
a.	details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant and
b.	details of UV and washer type filters and
c.	details of multi-stage filter systems and
d.	details of duplicate air-handling systems (duty and standby) 
e.	details of all ducting and outlets (at a minimum scale of 1:50)

The ventilation system shall thereafter be maintained in effective order to the reasonable satisfaction of the Council.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy SD6(e) of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 32 - Prior to commencement of works, a BREEAM Design Stage Assessment using the relevant tools for each component of the development must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. To be approved by the local planning authority, these assessments must show compliance with the submitted pre-assessment ratings, or provide satisfactory justification from the BREEAM Assessor for any non-compliance.  	

REASON: In order to secure the appropriate energy and resource efficiency measures and on-site renewable energy generation in accordance with the requirements of policies S3 and SD9C of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. as well as London Plan policies.
Condition : 33 - No development shall take place until the applicant, their agent or successors in title has secured the implemented of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Council. The development shall only take place in accordance with the detailed scheme pursuant to this condition. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Council.

Reason: Important archaeological remains may exist on this site. Accordingly the Council wishes to secure the provision of archaeological investigation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development in accordance with the requirements of policy B8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 34 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved drawings and schedule of accommodation nothing in this permission grants consent for areas of advertisement shown as GA02, GA03, GA04, GA05 on drawing AL-00G-C rev 03 along the western perimeter of the concourse. 

Reason: To safeguard the special character and appearance of the conservation area and the area in general in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 35 - No development shall commence until it can be demonstrated to the Council's satisfaction that a construction contract has been let for the arcading works to the Great Northern Hotel. The development approved shall be carried out in conjunction with the arcading of the Great Northern Hotel by Argent King's Cross (or its successors) and other stakeholders. 

Reason: to ensure the safe and unimpeded passage of station users in accordance with policies SD1(d) and B1(b) and to ensure that the pedestrian environment meets the needs of pedestrians in accordance with policy T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 36 - This consent does not convey approval for the precise location, form, design and details of the exit canopies, entrance canopy, taxi canopies and LUL south-east stairs (referred to on approved drawing AL-00G-S rev 03 as 'LUL stairs and Lift').

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building and the character of the conservation area in accordance with the requirements of policies B6, B7 & KC11 of the  London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 37 - The precise location, form, design and details of the following elements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, advised by English Heritage, before the relevant part of the works commence, and shall be contained within the zones identified in the submitted plans (AL-ZO-041, AL-ZO-042, AL-ZO-00G-C, AL-ZO-00G-S):

a. the 'exit' canopies;
b. the entrance canopy;
c. the taxi canopies;
d. the LUL south-east stairs (the location of which has already been agreed with LUL under CTRL Schedule 6 submissions).

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building and the character of the conservation area in accordance with the requirements of policies B6, B7 & KC11 of the  London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
